intro: Callirhoe scabriuscula, commonly known as the roughleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features hairy, gray-green leaves and produces vibrant yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping. Its botanical features make it an attractive and low-maintenance addition to native plant gardens.
